message:
SYSTEM: Vadim.pdf: Página 59
November 12, 2015
59
Gravitation and Fitness in Ontology Dynamics
Ontology is a Logical Theory
•
 
Ontology * – a tuple: 
O = (C, P, I, T, V, ≤, ┴, , =) 
•
 
where the sets C, P, I, T, V are pair-wise disjoint 
and: 
–
 
C – set of concepts (or classes) 
–
 
P – set of properties (object and datatype
 
properties) 
–
 
I
 
– set of individuals (or instances) 
–
 
T – set of datatypes
–
 
V – set of values
–
 
≤
 
–
 
reflexive, anti-symmetric, and transitive relation 
on (C x C ) U (P x P ) U (T x T ) called specialization, (subsumption) that form 
partial orders on: 
–
 
C – concept hierarchy; and 
–
 
P –
 
property hierarchy 
–
 
┴
 
–
 
irreflexive
 
and symmetric relation 
on (C x C ) U (P x P ) U (T x T ) called exclusion
–
 

 
–
 
relation over (I x C ) U (I x V ) called instantiation
–
 
= –
 
relation over I
 
U P U (I x V ) called assignment
* Euzenat
 
J. and Shvaiko
 
P. 2007. Ontology Matching, Berlin Heidelberg (DE), Springer-Verlag
speaker: SYSTEM
